title: Sir Rod Stewart full of pride as son scores first goal
title_page: Sir Rod Stewart full of pride as son  scores first goal | Daily Mail Online
text:
Sir Rod Stewart could not hide his pride after his son Liam scored his first goal for Great Britain in the 5-1 World Championship Division One Group B victory over Estonia in Belfast.
Liam scored nine goals and added 11 assists last season, his first in the UK for Coventry Blaze after a brief spell in American professional ice hockey with the Alaska Aces.
And Stewart posted a video on his Facebook page of him watching the goal from the BBC, enthusiastically saying 'my boy!' as Liam scored.
Rod Stewart smiles as he watches his son Liam's first international goal on the television
Stewart posted a video on his Facebook, enthusiastically saying 'my boy!' as Liam scored
'Great Britain thrash Estonia 5-1 in Belfast, with my boy Liam scoring his first International goal!!' he wrote alongside the clip.
'It brought a tear to my eye, so proud!!'
Rod missed Liam’s debut game as he was at Hampden to watch beat Rangers 2-0 in at the Scottish Cup semi-final on Sunday.
Liam took up ice hockey when he moved to to live with his mother – former model Rachel Hunterin – in California at the age of three.
